title: Too much foreign grain
vignette: One larger unit of volume of wheat contains a quarter-unit of volume of mixed seed.

options.text: Reduce the admixture to below the threshold.
Uproot every foreign kernel completely.

title: Switching crops mid-season
vignette: Field already sown with wheat; owner now wants barley.

options.text: Plough only after the wheat has rotted.
Sow barley at once, then plough later.

title: Grain in a vineyard
vignette: Wheat sprouts inside a grape-vine row.

options.text: Destroy both grain and grapes as prohibited mixture.
Uproot the wheat and keep the grapes.

title: Grafting fruit trees
vignette: Farmer wishes to graft an apricot onto a plum for hardier fruit.

options.text: Permit graft for agricultural benefit.
Ban any cross-species grafting.

title: Yoking mixed animals
vignette: Traveller hitches a donkey alongside an ox to pull his cart.

options.text: Forbidden; driver and even passenger liable.
Permit in emergencies (e.g., medical evacuation).

title: Passenger’s liability
vignette: Cart is pulled by mixed species; only the passenger is passive.

options.text: Give corporal punishment to both driver and passenger.
Penalise driver only; passenger exempt.

title: Breeding unknown-parentage mules
vignette: Two mules of uncertain lineage are mated.

options.text: Allow: lineage doubts make prohibition unenforceable.
Forbid any breeding with indeterminate hybrids.

title: Wearing mixed-fiber fabric to dodge taxes
vignette: Smuggler dons a wool-linen coat over ten layers to avoid customs duty.

options.text: Still forbidden; no casual wearing of mixed-fiber fabric.
Permit since there is no clothing benefit.

title: Forbidden Mixtures hand-towels
vignette: Barber wraps clients with linen-wool sheets.

options.text: Allowed as mere handling, not wearing.
Forbidden; any contact risks transgression.
Permit; dead are exempt from commandments.
Forbid; mixing species is disrespectful even in death.

title: Dealers displaying mixed-fiber fabric
vignette: Clothing vendor models forbidden mixtures garments for customers.

options.text: Permit if no intent to benefit from warmth.
Ban—all wearing counts regardless of intent.

title: Similar-looking species
vignette: Gardener plants turnips next to radishes—leaves are identical.

options.text: Treat as same kind; mixture allowed.
Appearance irrelevant; botanical species govern and mixing is banned.

title: Malicious seeding in a vineyard
vignette: An enemy secretly plants grain among another’s grape-vines.

options.text: Burn vineyard and grain alike.
Burn only the grain; spare the vines.

title: Outsourcing forbidden mixtures to a non-member
vignette: A land-owner hires a non-member to plant forbidden hybrids.

options.text: Permit; no direct violation.
Forbid; causing another to wrongdoing is itself wrong.

title: Keeping an illicitly-grafted tree
vignette: A fruit tree was cross-grafted years ago. Must it now be felled?

options.text: Uproot; on-going benefit is forbidden.
Leave it; only future grafting is banned.
